cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 44 (Tuesday, March 12, 2024)][House][Pages H1149-H1150]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TAKANO:H.R. 7643.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Government ReformADDITIONAL SPONSORSUnder clause 7 of rule XII, sponsors were added to public bills andresolutions, as follows:H.R. 16: Mr. Amo, Ms. Stansbury, Ms. Titus, Mr. Mfume, andMr. Green item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Clear Communication for Veterans Claims Act
Veterans Congressional Work Study Act of 2024
Veterans Congressional Work Study Act of 2024
Veterans Congressional Work Study Act of 2024

To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the use of Department of Veterans Affairs work-study allowance to carry out casework, policy making, and oversight related to the activities of the Department at certain congressional offices.

latestAction.text: Supplemental report filed by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, H. Rept. 118-596, Part II.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
